page.title: 10Transport in Ladock
page.content: There is very little public transport in Ladock. Lots of people have cars because they live a long way from the bus stops and shops and there is not a good public transport service. The road has been widened so they could have a pavement and it would be safer for pedestrians and drivers. At Ladock there are 2 different kinds of coaches,Harris Coaches and Cornwall Busways.Cornwall Busways link Ladock with the East and West of the county, they go through at the same time each day 10.00am and 2.15pm. Harris coaches go through Ladock to Truro from Summer Court 4 times on Weds and Sats and twice on other days. Children pay 25p and adults pay 45p for a single fare. A railway runs about a mile South of Ladock but there is no station at Ladock. The nearest stations are 8 miles away at St.Austell and Truro.
